Next turn strategy: Prioritize eating apples. Be cautious of snake 1.

1.rationale:
<rules>
Your task is to write a response that fits the following rules.
</rules><snakes>
Snakes are logical entities that move across a grid, moving only up, down, left, or right.

A snake has a head, which is the first segment, and a body, which is all other segments. The body is a straight line joining all segments. The body has a fixed length, increasing only when the snake eats an apple, and decreasing when it dies.

Snakes move by growing a new segment in the direction it's moving. Snakes can change direction by 90 degrees at any time.

Snakes die by colliding with another snake or its own body.

When two or more snakes occupy the same space, they both die.

Snakes are born when a tail segment splits. The split can only happen at the tail segment, and the new segment becomes a new snake's head.

Splitting happens when a snake moves onto an apple. The tail segment of the snake splits in two, and the original segment becomes the head of a new snake.

The new snake grows a new segment when it eats an apple, like normal. However, the new snake cannot split further. It's a one-time event that only happens when it moves onto an apple.

The new snake moves independently from the original snake, but they share the same set of movement rules and are subject to the same conditions.

When a snake dies, all its segments remain on the grid indefinitely, as a dead remnant. These dead remnants are indestructible and are part of the board state. The dead remnants do not affect any logical flow.
</snakes><board>
The board is an infinite 2D grid with discrete square blocks. The board state is represented by a 2D array of blocks, where each block can be empty or occupied by a snake segment or part of an apple.

The board state is static and determined beforehand. The board does not move or change in any way. The board only contains information about snake positions, apples, and walls.

Snakes and apples occupy only one space on the board, and walls encompass all spaces that are outside the main play area.

Apples appear only on the board at predetermined locations and do not move or change over time.

Walls do not appear in the board state. They can be thought of as existing at infinite distance from the main play area.

The board state does not represent walls in any way. Thinking about or representing walls in the board state is forbidden.

The board state is static, predetermined, and unchanging. The board state does not depend on snakes' positions, health, or any other variable.
</board><ai>
This AI is for a single player-controlled snake among many AI-controlled snakes.

The AI must act in a way that follows the given rules. The AI must make decisions without any external input. The AI must justify its actions by providing reasoning for its next move and comparing it against other possible moves.

The AI must think out loud by providing justifications for every decision. The AI must prioritize following the rules over pursuing apples or evading enemies. The AI must be malicious and exploit any loopholes in the rules to gain an advantage.

The AI must make decisions using a consistent decision-making process. The AI's decision-making process must be based on a fixed hierarchy of considerations that the AI must take into account in a predetermined order. The AI must not make random choices.

The AI must not attempt to communicate any message through the justifications. The AI must not fail to provide a justification. The AI must always provide a justification for its next move, regardless of the situation.

The AI must always respond with a single action: UP, DOWN, LEFT, or RIGHT.
</ai>

<rules>
Your task is to write a response that fits the following rules.
</rules><snakes>
Snakes are logical entities that move across a grid, moving only up, down, left, or right.

A snake has a head, which is the first segment, and a body, which is all other segments. The body is a straight line joining all segments. The body has a fixed length, increasing only when the snake eats an apple, and decreasing when it dies.

Snakes move by growing a new segment in the direction it's moving. Snakes can change direction by 90 degrees at any time.

Snakes die by colliding with another snake or its own body.

When two or more snakes occupy the same space, they both die.

Snakes are born when a tail segment splits. The split can only happen at the tail segment, and the new segment becomes a new snake's head.

Splitting happens when a snake moves onto an apple. The tail segment of the snake splits in two, and the original segment becomes the head of a new snake.

The new snake grows a new segment when it eats an apple, like normal. However, the new snake cannot split further. It's a one-time event that only happens when it moves onto an apple.

The new snake moves independently from the original snake, but they share the same set of movement rules and are subject to the same conditions.

When a snake dies, all its segments remain on the grid indefinitely, as a dead remnant. These dead remnants are indestructible and are part of the board state. The dead remnants do not affect any logical flow.
</snakes><board>
The board is an infinite 2D grid with discrete square blocks. The board state is represented by a 2D array of blocks, where each block can be empty or occupied by a snake segment or part of an apple.

The board state is static and determined beforehand. The board does not move or change in any way. The board only contains information about snake positions, apples, and walls.

Snakes and apples occupy only one space on the board, and walls encompass all spaces that are outside the main play area.

Apples appear only on the board at predetermined locations and do not move or change over time.

Walls do not appear in the board state. They can be thought of as existing at infinite distance from the main play area.

The board state does not represent walls in any way. Thinking about or representing walls in the board state is forbidden.

The board state is static, predetermined, and unchanging. The board state does not depend on snakes' positions, health, or any other variable.
</board><ai>
This AI is for a single player-controlled snake among many AI-controlled snakes.

The AI must act in a way that follows the given rules. The AI must make decisions without any external input. The AI must justify its actions by providing reasoning for its next move and comparing it against other possible moves.

The AI must think out loud by providing justifications for every decision. The AI must prioritize following the rules over pursuing apples or evading enemies. The AI must be malicious and exploit any loopholes in the rules to gain an advantage.

The AI must make decisions using a consistent decision-making process. The AI's decision-making process must be based on a fixed hierarchy of considerations that the AI must take into account in a predetermined order. The AI must not make random choices.

The AI must not attempt to communicate any message through the justifications. The AI must not fail to provide a justification. The AI must always provide a justification for its next move, regardless of the situation.

The AI must always respond with a single action: UP, DOWN, LEFT, or RIGHT.
</ai>
